2021-08-01.name: National Balloon Classic
2021-08-01.summary: This giant hot-air balloon festival includes daily flights, rides for the public, music, night glows and closing fireworks.

2021-08-01.name: Coast Guard Festival
2021-08-01.summary: There's nightly entertainment on the waterfront, a downtown carnival, tours of Coast Guard cutters, a Grand Parade and fireworks.

2021-08-01.name: EAA AirVenture
2021-08-01.summary: This huge Experimental Aircraft Association festival includes air shows, fireworks, big-name concerts, children's activities, workshops, exhibits and rides in historic aircraft.

2021-08-01.name: Lollapalooza
2021-08-01.summary: This big music festival features dozens of bands and, unlike other Grant Park festivals, is not free. Reserve rooms far in advance.

2021-08-01.name: Festa Italia
2021-08-01.summary: The heritage festival at McKee Farms Park in this Madison suburb features such things as folk dancing, a puppet show, a pasta-eating contest and vintage baseball as well as bocce ball.

2021-08-01.name: Festa Italiana
2021-08-01.summary: This festival at the Naper Settlement is a showcase for Italian culture, food, music and artisans and has two entertainment stages.

2021-08-02.name: National Balloon Classic
2021-08-02.summary: This giant hot-air balloon festival includes daily flights, rides for the public, music, night glows and closing fireworks.

2021-08-02.name: Coast Guard Festival
2021-08-02.summary: There's nightly entertainment on the waterfront, a downtown carnival, tours of Coast Guard cutters, a Grand Parade and fireworks.

2021-08-03.summary: There's nightly entertainment on the waterfront, a downtown carnival, tours of Coast Guard cutters, a Grand Parade and fireworks.

2021-08-03.name: Mississippi Valley Fair
2021-08-03.summary: There are chainsaw artists and alligator shows as well as a  carnival and grandstand acts that include national country musicians. Headliners include Locash, Keith Urban, Old Dominion and Pitbull.

2021-08-04.name: Lake Bemidji Dragon Boat Festival
2021-08-04.summary: In addition to boat races, there will be kids' activities, cultural performances, music and a parade of teams.

2021-08-05.summary: In addition to boat races, there will be kids' activities, cultural performances, music and a parade of teams.

2021-08-05.summary: The fair in this Milwaukee suburb features big-name musicians, a sea-lion show, a daily parade and lots of contests, including hog-calling, cookie-stacking and             cream puff-eating.

2021-08-05.name: Minnesota Bluegrass & Old-Time Music Festival
2021-08-05.summary: This family-friendly festival includes music             on five stages and workshops at El Rancho Mañana Campground, 20 miles west of St. Cloud.

2021-08-05.name: Fisherman's Picnic
2021-08-05.summary: There's a lot going on at the North Shore's biggest festival, including             loon-calling, log-rolling, herring-eating and rock-skipping contests; Saturday fireworks; and the grand parade on Sunday.

2021-08-05.name: Bix Beiderbecke Memorial Jazz Festival
2021-08-05.summary: Since 1972, fans of this Jazz Age cornetist and composer have held this             festival in his hometown on the Mississippi.

2021-08-05.name: WE Fest
2021-08-05.summary: Blake Shelton, Dierks Bentley and Florida Georgia Line are among the headliners at this big country festival in west-central Minnesota.

2021-08-05.name: Mile of Music
2021-08-05.summary: More than 180 singer-songwriters perform at more than 40 venues along College Avenue downtown.

2021-08-06.summary: This festival in central Iowa, just west of Ames, is named for a steam engine and features a spike-driving contest, mud volleyball and rides on the Boone and Scenic Valley Railroad. A parade is Saturday.

2021-08-06.name: River City Days
2021-08-06.summary: In this Mississippi River town, there's music, food and games in Bay Point Park and an arts show in Levee             Park. The parade is at 1 p.m. Sunday.

2021-08-06.name: Tall Timber Days
2021-08-06.summary: In this longtime logging town, there will be lumberjack shows, chainsaw carving, music and a parade Sunday.

2021-08-06.name: Brat Days
2021-08-06.summary: This town on Lake Michigan is sausage central. There's music, a carnival, beer and, of course, a brat-eating             contest. The parade is Saturday.

2021-08-06.name: Pie Day
2021-08-06.summary: Minnesota's official Pie Capital near Cambridge holds pie-eating contests, a pie trivia contest and performances of the             Pie-Alleuia Chorus.

2021-08-13.name: Wisconsin State Fair
2021-08-13.summary: The fair in this Milwaukee suburb features big-name musicians, a sea-lion show, a daily parade and lots of contests, including hog-calling, cookie-stacking and             cream puff-eating.

2021-08-13.name: Iowa State Fair
2021-08-13.summary: See a diaper derby, outhouse races and mullet contest, and don't miss the butter sculptures.

2021-08-13.name: Sweet Corn Festival
2021-08-13.summary: The festival in this town between Rochelle and La Salle features nearly 50 tons of free buttered corn, live music, a flea market, a carnival and a parade.

2021-08-13.name: Ashley for the Arts music festival
2021-08-13.summary: This nonprofit festival is in the southwest Wisconsin bluffs, half an hour north of Winona, Minn.

2021-08-13.name: Bayfront Blues Festival
2021-08-13.summary: The annual music fest on the Lake Superior harbor showcases national and regional             acts on three stages.

2021-08-13.name: Irish Fair
2021-08-13.summary: This big heritage fest on the banks of the Mississippi includes Irish  Got Talent and best legs in a kilt contests, hurling demonstrations,  dancing and lots of music.

2021-08-13.name: Iowa Arts Festival
2021-08-13.summary: This free downtown festival features an art show, a Global Village, a Culinary Row and music and dance. Sunday is Children's Day, with 10 booths of hands-on activities.

2021-08-13.name: Art & Big Fork Festival
2021-08-13.summary: This downtown festival features live music and local food, beer, wine and fine art.

2021-08-13.name: Burger Fest
2021-08-13.summary: This town west of Green Bay calls itself Home of the Hamburger, based  on a local 15-year-old who put ground-beef patties in a bun, called  them hamburgers and sold them at the Seymour Fair in 1885.

2021-08-13.name: Quad Cities Balloon Festival
2021-08-13.summary: This festival at the Rock Island County Fairgrounds includes balloon glows, launches, tethered rides and a play area for children.

2021-08-13.name: Tall Tales Music Festival
2021-08-13.summary: This free festival celebrates storytelling through music, with performances by national as well as regional musicians. In addition, workshops are offered for people of all ages.

2021-08-14.summary: Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free classical concerts in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2021-08-14.summary: This free festival celebrates storytelling through music, with performances by national as well as regional musicians. In addition, workshops are offered for people of all ages.

2021-08-14.name: Pure Water Days
2021-08-14.summary: There's a big parade downtown, followed by Riverfest in Allen Park.

2021-08-14.name: Shawano Folk Music Festival
2021-08-14.summary: The free, family-friendly festival in this northwoods town includes dance, crafts, children's activities and instruction in Franklin Park.

2021-08-14.name: IndiaFest
2021-08-14.summary: On the State Capitol grounds, watch Bollywood dance and a parade of cultures, eat East Indian food, get your hands painted with henna and learn the principles of cricket and yoga.

2021-08-18.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2021-08-18.summary: Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free classical concerts in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2021-08-18.name: Iowa State Fair
2021-08-18.summary: See a diaper derby, outhouse races and mullet contest, and don't miss the butter sculptures.

2021-08-18.name: Venetian Festival
2021-08-18.summary: In this southeast Wisconsin vacation area, the festival includes a carnival, arts and crafts fair, firefighter water fight and, on Sunday, a water-ski show followed by a lighted boat parade and fireworks.

2021-08-20.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2021-08-20.summary: Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free classical concerts in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2021-08-20.name: Iowa State Fair
2021-08-20.summary: See a diaper derby, outhouse races and mullet contest, and don't miss the butter sculptures.

2021-08-20.name: Venetian Festival
2021-08-20.summary: In this southeast Wisconsin vacation area, the festival includes a carnival, arts and crafts fair, firefighter water fight and, on Sunday, a water-ski show followed by a lighted boat parade and fireworks.

2021-08-20.name: Blue Ox Music Festival
2021-08-20.summary: This family-friendly acoustic festival is near Eau Claire and features Charlie Parr, Shakey Graves, Lissie, Molly Tuttle, Sam Bush and others.

2021-08-20.name: Ki-Chi-Saga Days
2021-08-20.summary: The fest in this town just north of St. Paul features an Old World  market, sandcastle and skateboard contests, Swedish dancers, a horn  hunt, fireworks Saturday and a parade on Sunday.

2021-08-20.name: Sweet Corn Festival
2021-08-20.summary: A Thursday-night parade kicks off this festival just north of Madison, and there's also a craft fair, car show, tractor pull, music, carnival rides and, on Saturday and Sunday, literally tons of steamed sweet corn.

2021-08-20.name: Oronoco Gold Rush
2021-08-20.summary: The antiques show and flea market in this friendly little village just north of Rochester off U.S. 52 includes more than 400 vendors and 1,200 booths. There's also pancakes for breakfast, homemade pie and music.

2021-08-20.name: Irish Fest
2021-08-20.summary: The nation's largest Irish festival features 100 acts on 16 stages, plus children's activities, red hair and freckle contests and demonstrations by Irish dog breeds. In Henry Maier Festival Park.

2021-08-20.name: Blues, Brews & BBQ
2021-08-20.summary: Listen to the blues and eat barbecued foods in Petersen Park on McCollum Lake.

2021-08-20.name: Winnie The Pooh Festival
2021-08-20.summary: The hometown of the famous children's-book bear celebrates with a block party, bounce houses, parades and fireworks.

2021-08-20.name: Michigan Full Moon Fest
2021-08-20.summary: There will be three days of blues music and camping in this village, 10 miles east of South Haven.

2021-08-20.name: Big Bull Falls Blues Fest
2021-08-20.summary: Enjoy national and local blues musicians in Fern Island Park. There's a beer garden, of course.

2021-08-20.name: Lake Geneva Blues Festival
2021-08-20.summary: This first annual festival features local, regional and national performers on two stages at the House of Music festival grounds east of Lake Como.

2021-08-21.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2021-08-21.summary: Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free classical concerts in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2021-08-21.name: Iowa State Fair
2021-08-21.summary: See a diaper derby, outhouse races and mullet contest, and don't miss the butter sculptures.

2021-08-21.summary: In this southeast Wisconsin vacation area, the festival includes a carnival, arts and crafts fair, firefighter water fight and, on Sunday, a water-ski show followed by a lighted boat parade and fireworks.

2021-08-21.summary: This family-friendly acoustic festival is near Eau Claire and features Charlie Parr, Shakey Graves, Lissie, Molly Tuttle, Sam Bush and others.

2021-08-21.summary: The fest in this town just north of St. Paul features an Old World  market, sandcastle and skateboard contests, Swedish dancers, a horn  hunt, fireworks Saturday and a parade on Sunday.

2021-08-21.summary: A Thursday-night parade kicks off this festival just north of Madison, and there's also a craft fair, car show, tractor pull, music, carnival rides and, on Saturday and Sunday, literally tons of steamed sweet corn.

2021-08-21.summary: The nation's largest Irish festival features 100 acts on 16 stages, plus children's activities, red hair and freckle contests and demonstrations by Irish dog breeds. In Henry Maier Festival Park.

2021-08-21.name: Blues, Brews & BBQ
2021-08-21.summary: Listen to the blues and eat barbecued foods in Petersen Park on McCollum Lake.

2021-08-21.name: Winnie The Pooh Festival
2021-08-21.summary: The hometown of the famous children's-book bear celebrates with a block party, bounce houses, parades and fireworks.

2021-08-21.name: Michigan Full Moon Fest
2021-08-21.summary: There will be three days of blues music and camping in this village, 10 miles east of South Haven.

2021-08-21.name: Big Bull Falls Blues Fest
2021-08-21.summary: Enjoy national and local blues musicians in Fern Island Park. There's a beer garden, of course.

2021-08-21.name: Lake Geneva Blues Festival
2021-08-21.summary: This first annual festival features local, regional and national performers on two stages at the House of Music festival grounds east of Lake Como.

2021-08-21.name: HarborPark Jazz & Blues Festival
2021-08-21.summary: This free festival is in the lakefront Celebration Place.

2021-08-21.name: Soar on the Shore
2021-08-21.summary: Learn about kite-flying from professionals on Lake Michigan's Crescent Beach. There will be giant-kite and stunt shows and crafts and a candy drop for kids.

2021-08-21.name: PastyFest
2021-08-21.summary: The humble miner's lunch — meat and rutabagas in a pocket of pie crust — has inspired this Keweenaw Peninsula festival, which includes such events as a PastyWalk, PastyPoetry contest and, of course, a PastyCook-Off.

2021-08-21.name: Porchfest
2021-08-21.summary: Forty musical acts will play on 10 historic porches, including Fairlawn, from noon to 6 p.m. There will also be storytellers, dance, theater, an art fair and food trucks.

2021-08-26.name: Minnesota State Fair
2021-08-26.summary: Try flights at the Craft Beer Hall, eat food on a stick, listen to free concerts and watch the 2 p.m. daily parade.

2021-08-26.name: Lakes Bluegrass Festival
2021-08-26.summary: This family-friendly festival, just off the Paul Bunyan State Trail, features more than 40 bluegrass shows and free workshops.

2021-08-26.name: Orton-Front Festival
2021-08-26.summary: The Marquette Waterfront and Orton Park festivals combine this year, with aerial dance and family entertainment in Orton Park and, in Yahara Place Park on Lake Monona, music on two stages and children's games.

2021-08-27.name: Minnesota State Fair
2021-08-27.summary: Try flights at the Craft Beer Hall, eat food on a stick, listen to free concerts and watch the 2 p.m. daily parade.

2021-08-27.name: Lakes Bluegrass Festival
2021-08-27.summary: This family-friendly festival, just off the Paul Bunyan State Trail, features more than 40 bluegrass shows and free workshops.

2021-08-27.name: Artstreet
2021-08-27.summary: Artists, performers and craft and food             stands fill streets downtown near the Fox River.

2021-08-27.name: Mexican Fiesta
2021-08-27.summary: Enjoy the best of Mexican culture at the Henry Maier             Festival Park: mariachi, arts and crafts, spicy foods and contests: dance, costume, jalapeno-eating and el grito, or shouting.

2021-08-27.name: Great River Folk Festival
2021-08-27.summary: This festival in Riverside Park includes children's activities, a traditional arts and crafts fair and music performances and workshops.

2021-08-27.name: Potato Days
2021-08-27.summary: This goofy central-Minnesota festival features mashed-potato wrestling, a golden potato hunt, potato car races, peeling and eating contests and a Saturday parade.

2021-08-27.name: HarborFest
2021-08-27.summary: This Lake Superior town celebrates with rock and blues music, a classic car and  motorcycle show, a luge run and inflatables for kids.

2021-08-28.name: Minnesota State Fair
2021-08-28.summary: Try flights at the Craft Beer Hall, eat food on a stick, listen to free concerts and watch the 2 p.m. daily parade.

2021-08-28.name: Lakes Bluegrass Festival
2021-08-28.summary: This family-friendly festival, just off the Paul Bunyan State Trail, features more than 40 bluegrass shows and free workshops.

2021-08-28.name: Orton-Front Festival
2021-08-28.summary: The Marquette Waterfront and Orton Park festivals combine this year, with aerial dance and family entertainment in Orton Park and, in Yahara Place Park on Lake Monona, music on two stages and children's games.

2021-08-28.name: Artstreet
2021-08-28.summary: Artists, performers and craft and food             stands fill streets downtown near the Fox River.

2021-08-28.name: Mexican Fiesta
2021-08-28.summary: Enjoy the best of Mexican culture at the Henry Maier             Festival Park: mariachi, arts and crafts, spicy foods and contests: dance, costume, jalapeno-eating and el grito, or shouting.

2021-08-28.name: Great River Folk Festival
2021-08-28.summary: This festival in Riverside Park includes children's activities, a traditional arts and crafts fair and music performances and workshops.

2021-08-28.name: Oneida Pow-Wow
2021-08-28.summary: This free family festival near Green Bay features dancing, singing, drumming, indigenous foods and crafts and lacrosse exhibitions.

2021-08-28.name: Grant's Home Front Reenactment
2021-08-28.summary: In Ulysses S. Grant's hometown, living-history reenacters hold an encampment along the river and stage Civil War battle reenactments at 11:30 a.m. Saturday and 1:30 p.m. Sunday.

2021-08-28.summary: This goofy central-Minnesota festival features mashed-potato wrestling, a golden potato hunt, potato car races, peeling and eating contests and a Saturday parade.

2021-08-28.name: Crossroads Blues Festival
2021-08-28.summary: Enjoy a day of blues in Lyran Park, with food from local restaurants.

2021-08-28.name: Vinton Boomtown
2021-08-28.summary: Fireworks provided by the Iowa Pyrotechnic Association are the centerpiece for this fest, which includes arts & crafts, food and kids' activities.

2021-08-09.name: Wisconsin State Fair
2021-08-09.summary: The fair in this Milwaukee suburb features big-name musicians, a sea-lion show, a daily parade and lots of contests, including hog-calling, cookie-stacking and             cream puff-eating.

2021-08-10.name: Wisconsin State Fair
2021-08-10.summary: The fair in this Milwaukee suburb features big-name musicians, a sea-lion show, a daily parade and lots of contests, including hog-calling, cookie-stacking and             cream puff-eating.

2021-08-12.name: Wisconsin State Fair
2021-08-12.summary: The fair in this Milwaukee suburb features big-name musicians, a sea-lion show, a daily parade and lots of contests, including hog-calling, cookie-stacking and             cream puff-eating.

2021-08-12.name: Iowa State Fair
2021-08-12.summary: See a diaper derby, outhouse races and mullet contest, and don't miss the butter sculptures.

2021-08-12.name: Sweet Corn Festival
2021-08-12.summary: The festival in this town between Rochelle and La Salle features nearly 50 tons of free buttered corn, live music, a flea market, a carnival and a parade.

2021-08-12.name: Ashley for the Arts music festival
2021-08-12.summary: This nonprofit festival is in the southwest Wisconsin bluffs, half an hour north of Winona, Minn.

2021-08-12.name: White Sox vs. Yankees at the Field of Dreams
2021-08-12.summary: The Yankees will play the White Sox at the Field of Dreams movie site in a cornfield near Dubuque.

2021-08-15.name: Wisconsin State Fair

2021-08-15.summary: See a diaper derby, outhouse races and mullet contest, and don't miss the butter sculptures.

2021-08-15.name: Sweet Corn Festival
2021-08-15.summary: The festival in this town between Rochelle and La Salle features nearly 50 tons of free buttered corn, live music, a flea market, a carnival and a parade.

2021-08-15.name: Bayfront Blues Festival
2021-08-15.summary: The annual music fest on the Lake Superior harbor showcases national and regional             acts on three stages.

2021-08-15.name: Irish Fair
2021-08-15.summary: This big heritage fest on the banks of the Mississippi includes Irish  Got Talent and best legs in a kilt contests, hurling demonstrations,  dancing and lots of music.

2021-08-15.name: Iowa Arts Festival
2021-08-15.summary: This free downtown festival features an art show, a Global Village, a Culinary Row and music and dance. Sunday is Children's Day, with 10 booths of hands-on activities.

2021-08-15.name: Art & Big Fork Festival
2021-08-15.summary: This downtown festival features live music and local food, beer, wine and fine art.

2021-08-16.name: Iowa State Fair
2021-08-16.summary: See a diaper derby, outhouse races and mullet contest, and don't miss the butter sculptures.

2021-08-17.name: Iowa State Fair
2021-08-17.summary: See a diaper derby, outhouse races and mullet contest, and don't miss the butter sculptures.

2021-08-19.name: Iowa State Fair
2021-08-19.summary: See a diaper derby, outhouse races and mullet contest, and don't miss the butter sculptures.

2021-08-19.name: Venetian Festival
2021-08-19.summary: In this southeast Wisconsin vacation area, the festival includes a carnival, arts and crafts fair, firefighter water fight and, on Sunday, a water-ski show followed by a lighted boat parade and fireworks.

2021-08-19.name: Blue Ox Music Festival
2021-08-19.summary: This family-friendly acoustic festival is near Eau Claire and features Charlie Parr, Shakey Graves, Lissie, Molly Tuttle, Sam Bush and others.

2021-08-19.name: Ki-Chi-Saga Days
2021-08-19.summary: The fest in this town just north of St. Paul features an Old World  market, sandcastle and skateboard contests, Swedish dancers, a horn  hunt, fireworks Saturday and a parade on Sunday.

2021-08-19.name: Sweet Corn Festival
2021-08-19.summary: A Thursday-night parade kicks off this festival just north of Madison, and there's also a craft fair, car show, tractor pull, music, carnival rides and, on Saturday and Sunday, literally tons of steamed sweet corn.

2021-08-22.name: Iowa State Fair
2021-08-22.summary: See a diaper derby, outhouse races and mullet contest, and don't miss the butter sculptures.

2021-08-22.name: Venetian Festival
2021-08-22.summary: In this southeast Wisconsin vacation area, the festival includes a carnival, arts and crafts fair, firefighter water fight and, on Sunday, a water-ski show followed by a lighted boat parade and fireworks.

2021-08-22.name: Ki-Chi-Saga Days
2021-08-22.summary: The fest in this town just north of St. Paul features an Old World  market, sandcastle and skateboard contests, Swedish dancers, a horn  hunt, fireworks Saturday and a parade on Sunday.

2021-08-22.name: Sweet Corn Festival
2021-08-22.summary: A Thursday-night parade kicks off this festival just north of Madison, and there's also a craft fair, car show, tractor pull, music, carnival rides and, on Saturday and Sunday, literally tons of steamed sweet corn.

2021-08-22.name: Oronoco Gold Rush
2021-08-22.summary: The antiques show and flea market in this friendly little village just north of Rochester off U.S. 52 includes more than 400 vendors and 1,200 booths. There's also pancakes for breakfast, homemade pie and music.

2021-08-22.name: Irish Fest
2021-08-22.summary: The nation's largest Irish festival features 100 acts on 16 stages, plus children's activities, red hair and freckle contests and demonstrations by Irish dog breeds. In Henry Maier Festival Park.

2021-08-22.name: Blues, Brews & BBQ
2021-08-22.summary: Listen to the blues and eat barbecued foods in Petersen Park on McCollum Lake.

2021-08-22.name: Winnie The Pooh Festival
2021-08-22.summary: The hometown of the famous children's-book bear celebrates with a block party, bounce houses, parades and fireworks.

2021-08-22.name: Michigan Full Moon Fest
2021-08-22.summary: There will be three days of blues music and camping in this village, 10 miles east of South Haven.

2021-08-25.name: Lakes Bluegrass Festival
2021-08-25.summary: This family-friendly festival, just off the Paul Bunyan State Trail, features more than 40 bluegrass shows and free workshops.
